Base¶

Geometry¶

class decodes.core.dc_base.Geometry¶

A base geometry class for all other geometry to inherit.

__mul__(other)¶

Overloads the multiplication (*) operator.

Parameters:other (Geometry) – Geometry to be multiplied.
Result :New geometry.
Return type:Geometry
__weakref__¶

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

copy_props(other)¶

Transfers the properties of the other geometry to this geometry, overwriting any properties this object currently has

do_translate¶

if this property is set to false, outies will not translate this geometry into external formats, and pass along the class as-is.

set_color(a, b=None, c=None)¶

Sets the geometry’s color

Parameters:
  • a (Color or float) – Color object to set the geometry’s color, or number value (between 0 and 1) to create a new color. If only a is passed as a float, the color will be greyscale.
  • b (float) – If no color object is passed, the G value in an RGB scale.
  • c (float) – If no color object is passed, the B value in an RGB scale.
Result :

Sets the geometry’s color.
Return type:

Geometry
set_fill(a, b=None, c=None)¶

Sets the geometry’s fill

Parameters:
  • a (Color or float) – Color object to set the geometry’s fill, or number value (between 0 and 1) to create a new color. If only a is passed as a float, the color will be greyscale.
  • b (float) – If no color object is passed, the G value in an RGB scale.
  • c (float) – If no color object is passed, the B value in an RGB scale.
Result :

Sets the geometry’s fill.
Return type:

Geometry
set_name(str)¶

Sets the geometry’s name

Parameters:str (str) – A str with the new geometry’s name.
Result :Sets the geometry’s name.
Return type:Geometry
set_weight(num)¶

Sets the geometry’s weight

Parameters:num (float) – A number with the new geometry’s weight.
Result :Sets the geometry’s name.
Return type:Geometry

HasBasis¶

class decodes.core.dc_base.HasBasis¶

A base class for anything that wants to define a basis for itself. Bases must implement the following methods:

basis_applied(copy_children=True)¶

Returns a new object with basis applied. Copies of are created of any child objects by default. Take care to copy over props if appropriate.

Result :Object with basis applied.
Return type:Basis
basis_stripped(copy_children=True)¶

Returns a new object stripped of any basis. Copies of are created of any child objects by default. Take care to copy over props if appropriate.

Result :Object with basis applied.
Return type:Basis
is_baseless¶

Tells us if a basis has been defined
